In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    col = lowercase(strip(col)) # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    col = replace(col, r"\s+", "_") # Replace spaces with underscores
    col = replace(col, "-", "_") # Replace hyphens with underscores
    return col
end
```
This function takes a column name as input and returns the cleaned version of the column name. It first strips any leading or trailing whitespaces from the input using `strip`. Then it replaces any spaces and hyphens in the string with underscores using regular expressions. Finally, it returns the cleaned column name.

For example, if we pass `"My Column"` as input to this function, it will return `"my_column"`.
